description: Garden enthusiasts will enjoy a stroll through this manicured landscape.

reviews.title: One of my favorite gardens in Toronto
text: This is a beautiful garden. A bit out of the way, but worth the drive. Its lovely to walk around the paths and see the greenery.

reviews.title: Beautiful Garden
text: The best time to come here is during Spring where there is a nice display of tulips and cherry blossoms.

reviews.title: Ok but nothing special.
text: Ok for a nice short walk if you want to see flowers.  Fairly popular for wedding pictures and slightly crowded on the weekends.  Nothing special but it’s a good way to pass an hour.

reviews.title: Nice
text: This garden is super beautiful in spring because it is full of flowers and with a lot of space for picnics and family activities. They have a nice trail through the park as well.

reviews.title: Put Spring in your step
text: Enchanting place for rest, relaxation and rejuvenation. Every season offers new colors, flora and fauna. It may not be as extensive as Hamilton's botanical gardens but it is still a lovely respite in the city.

reviews.title: Keep coming back to the place
text: We keep coming back to this place whenever we are in the area due to the combination of great wildlife and floral arrangements:
- this place is free to enter, however we tend to avoid the weekend when seems to be busier and the car park gets full rather fast
- there is a shop, toilets etc with very nice friendly staff

- lots of flowers, as you would expect but we are keen ornithologists and had several birds come and eat from my palm, besides black and brown squirrels following us around, together with chipmunks and other type of birds.  I did not see the ground hog we came across several years ago but we had ducks flying around us - that is why I like coming here when there are not many people around after all
- we spent around 90min relaxing on the bench, talking to animals and birds and taking pictures of this beautiful place
Well done to the hard working staff.  Most surely we will be back.

reviews.title: Fantastic place for kid hikes
text: Fantastic place to take kiddos at any time of the year.  My kids are 4 and 5 and they love wandering off the trails, playing near the streams, and spotting wildlife.  In Autumn, we hit up the "golden forests".

reviews.title: EZ park & walk
text: Spend a free afternoon exploring nature on well-groomed park grounds and observe all sorts of wildlife like groundhogs, and hawks in trees or just feed the Chipmunks! ;)

reviews.title: Amazing gardens
text: We toured the gardens. Many blooming plants and lots of huge old trees. Paths wind through the gardens and trees.

reviews.title: An Oasis to Sooth the Soul
text: Many a times during the pandemic we escaped to this beautiful space! It is not that close to us but it was worth spending the time to get there. Everything is opened up and we tend to less frequent them. Just went back for a visit and it is jsut as charming with many flowers in bloom.
Some of the paths blocked during the pandemic are now open providing further trolling options. A place to sooth your soul !

reviews.title: Perfect for Landscape/Nature Photography
text: I went to this park last year of winter (2019). Despite the snow and the ice everywhere, there were a lot trees with leaves still intact. The trees had a nice mix of snow and green leaves around. There's also a pond and a small water falls in the park.

reviews.title: Scenic Gardens
text: Edwards Gardens is located at the corner of Leslie St. and Lawrence Ave. adjacent to the Toronto Botanical Gardens. As we live nearby we have spent many hours walking the variety of trails that meander through the valley, over bridges and along a creek. There is an amazing array of flowers, shrubs and trees and many rest areas where you can enjoy nature’s beauty and escape from the reality of the noisy city. On weekends it does get crowded with families enjoying an outing and wedding parties taking photos. Best to go during the week or early morning. You can enjoy these scenic gardens during any season but fall presents a wonderful display of colors. Admission is free and there is a minimal parking fee.

reviews.title: Lovely
text: In the heart of Toronto, sits a beautiful park with steams running throughout it. The few flowers and vast array of plantation still serve to leave you enchanted with nature.
A definite place to visit!

reviews.title: great place for a romantic walk
text: go there often for a walk with my partner. its peaceful and not too crowded. you have to pay for parking now. thats sad.

reviews.title: garden
text: A beautiful place on a nice sunny day to walk through and see all the gardens. Visitors and weddings photos its all great to spend time here for anything

reviews.title: Beautiful park.
text: We visited this park on a sunny Saturday afternoon.  The parking lot was busy but not full. The park is free but there is a small parking fee. There was an indoor building and a small cafe. The cafe was a little on the pricey side.
The park was very clean and well kept. It is a very good place to go for a leisure walk.

reviews.title: Spacious and beautifully manicured grounds in east mid-town Toronto.
text: This is a lovely low cost place to visit that is great for horticultural viewing or a fairly extensive hiking experience, almost in the middle of Toronto.
This is one of my favourite places to check out the colours of the Autumn leaves changing colour, there is a winding brook with foot bridges and Willow trees plus a great
gift shop and a snack bar.
Edwards Gardens also has fabulous Orchid and other plant shows through-out the year, it is a great place to go for a nice relaxing walk in the north-eastern heart of Toronto.

reviews.title: Great Visit, awesome photos...
text: Overall it is an awesome park to walk around, if you like to take great photos this is a place to be in, clean and lots of sculptures, flowers. This is great for people who is looking for peace, great for hiking.

reviews.title: Great to place to visit: Edward Gardens
text: A must see. It is free and free parking as well. Lots of landscaping designs and various types of flowers and shrubs. People do their wedding portraits and photo shoots there but they have to pay. Actually my sister did hers there. You can bike as well all the way south on the bike lane. It can go all the to Lakeshore if you follow the bike path.

reviews.title: Good for recreation
text: Its attached to botanical garden, so mostly people get confused with botanical garden. The landscaping is good and good for evening stroll during summer.

reviews.title: Nice autumn walk
text: Several years have passed since we last visited Edwards Gardens, but in these pandemic days we are retracing our steps through a number of parks and ravines. On Sunday afternoon the Gardens were quite full, though it was cool and overcast. Evidently many other people had the same idea we did. The flowers are mostly gone now, though asters and chrysanthemums are still in flower. The scenery is nice as always. The cafe is open, as is the gift shop.

reviews.title: Teeny Tiny (but perfect) Botanical Gdns
text: A little underwhelming when you consider botanical gardens in - well - just about any other city in North America or Europe, but this one, despite it's proximity to not much other than upscale housing (and problematic to get to via public transit)..it transcends it's naturally occurring obstacles and in the end is -  pretty ,well-kept, well sign-posted, and has plenty of parking and a small cafe for a coffee or nibble. The valley portion is very natural and pretty while the more studied, planned and tamed upper is designed to impress. Lovely shop for gardeners and gifters, a pleasant water feature, and an event space which seems often to host weddings, makes it a popular spot. Check it out.....

reviews.title: Green Garden
text: Also known as Toronto Botanical Gardens, Edwards Gardens is an ideal place to have some time in nature. It's a huge lark where you can go for a long walk or a time out with yourself. It can also be a nice spot for a picnic if you're in the mood.

reviews.title: 2019 Review
text: I feel a little embarassed by Edwards Gardens because they are waiting for Toronto Botanical Garden to fix the broken patio, bridge, and other crumbling areas when they have money.  Toronto Botanical Gardens fought for management control of this place, and got it in 2018, and then first thing they did (after making their vision plan) was to charge parking fees.  I think Rupert Edwards would turn in his grave if he knew, because he sold it to Metro Parks on the condition that there would never be any fees charged to enter his former estate.  I'm so disappointed in the city's decision to allow the TBG to do this to the public.  Otherwise, this is a beautiful park, full of memories for me and my family and friends, I go there almost every week in every season to walk.

reviews.title: lovely park
text: best to come in June to see the rhododendrons bloom. Bit crowded in the weekends but very good for walks jogging, biking etc

reviews.title: Beautiful place
text: Great for summer activities. A very nice and shady trail. A parking spot might hard to be found during weekend.

reviews.title: Great Walk
text: Walk around the park was wonderful, we ended up in a neighbourhood with beautiful homes. Ended up back at the garden, but was a nice walk

reviews.title: Our finest public garden goes to pay per visit system!
text: For more than 50 years my family has been visiting this urban treasure in all seasons.   From music in the park to varying floral displays and simply opportunities to sit, meditate and watch the birds and squirrels, this has been our go to place for peace and quiet.   Unfortunately, our politicians have expanded the  shameful policy of charging visitors to park if they wish to enjoy this part of the wonderful Toronto parks system.   As they did with the Brickworks, access to these public places has been placed in the hands of affluent volunteers who give of their time and expertise but have introduced a relatively expensive parking system which penalizes those who make frequent visits to the parks or wish to linger for longer walks along the trails.   I do not believe that visits to any public parks should come with a price tag.   I anticipate the outcry when Councillors approve parking fees for High Park.

reviews.title: Edwards Gardens
text: Nice piece of nature in the middle of the city. There is a ravine with trails for walking/biking and it's popular spot for wedding photos.

reviews.title: Serenity in a busy city
text: Come here just to wander the beautiful gardens and trails.  However, last summer, we held our daughter and son-in-law's wedding anniversary party here.  Fabulous venue with fantastic caterers.  Later came back to see the beautiful sculptures on display from Zimbabwe and the sculptors at work there as well.  These sculptures were available for purchase, although they were too expensive for us.

reviews.title: Small garden
text: Edward Gardens itself is rather small. While the park and trails are big, the botanical gardens can be walked through in a short time. Compared to other gardens, it is not a big attraction.

reviews.title: Beautiful Creations
text: a Gem in Toronto. (Botanical gardens, curated to perfection). Scenic and a nice walk-through from spring to fall. Highly recommended.

reviews.title: Green Stuff Galore
text: ...and colour too. Space. Plants, trees.
Go early.
Avoid weekends unless you like crowds.
Outside, inside all good.
Stay a while, join a class

reviews.title: A typical forest that's nice to venture through if you're already at the Toronto Botanical Gardens
text: Parking is cheap ($2.50 per hour at the Toronto Botanical Gardens), and admission is free as it is an open park. Good for taking a walk or bike riding. Not much to see though.

reviews.title: Lovely morning visit
text: So peaceful and tranquil, walked for miles and saw some beautiful flowers. Well worth a visit if you are interested 8n gardens

reviews.title: Beautiful, calming
text: They have 'forest bathing', so I guess Edwards Gardens can lay claim to 'garden bathing'. A beautiful place to relax and enjoy nature, with both educational gardens and access to miles of park paths. The gardens by the main building are diverse and well marked for gardeners, and attract birders (you often will find groups of people holding expensive camera equipment and standing stock still, waiting for a hummingbird.)  There is also a charming teaching garden in another section. Entrance is free; parking is not (although there is free parking at the west side of the Gardens.)

reviews.title: Gorgeous Place for Photos
text: A beautiful garden oasis, right in the middle of the city! We had our engagement photos taken here and it was a wonderful experience. The different river, garden, and woodland landscapes were so fun to take and it was a great nature escape. Would recommend!

reviews.title: Very pretty but not suitable for someone in a wheelchair
text: The wheelchair gets stuck on the uneven paths.  I thought the children's garden would be wheelchair friendly, but sadly it was not.  There are children in wheelchairs that would love to get up close to some of the thoughtful flower and vegetable beds constructed for learning.

reviews.title: Beautiful
text: Beautiful well worth the trip.  Gorgeous scenery and flowers.  Nice place to walk.  Lots of places to rest and sit as well

reviews.title: Lovely walk
text: Started walking here last year and now live it. Lots of different trails and you will always find something new everytime. Love walking in every season. Just that the place gets super crowded when the weather is good.
